item.title: Abandoned car, 15th December
item.description:
This car has been here for two months and has never moved. It used to have a notice on the car issued by "Princess Alice pub“ for parking but it has since deteriorated due to weather. It’s parked awkwardly on our busy road so it’s hard for residents to find parking because of the space that this car is taking up
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Delisle Road, Thamesmead

item.description:

item.title: Traffic lights on the junction of Gascony avenue, Kilburn high road and Willesden lane, 15th December
item.description:
I was attempting to cross the street tonight using the temporary traffic lights and when they turned green I proceeded to cross. However, the cars going south started moving at the same time and I nearly got run over. Either there is an issue with the phasing of the lights or someone was not paying attention to the roads. In any case, it would be best to check on them to avoid any potential accidents
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Willesden Lane, Queen's Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet more flytipping southern end of Stroud Green Road, 15th December
item.description:
Worse than usual fly tipping on the Islington side of the southern end of Stroud Green Road. I wish the council would take this corner of their borough seriously, we have to live here even if it is on the extremity and bordering other boroughs it shouldn't matter. It's not even a convenient spot to flytip but people do as they know Islington don't enforce it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Station Place, Finsbury Park, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ref: 8354962 unsolved issue. Trip hazards, 15th December
item.description:
I am replying to your reply stating that my claim "does not exceed the councils threshold". I am absolutely shocked that you can come to this conclusion, I am confident that no one has even come out to look into this matter, because if they had, then their decision would not have been to ignore it. How many warnings can I give you that elderly people live up this road and are at risk all day every day at tripping over your many uneven slabs. Please please take a close look at our Close and tell me that both sides of the road do not present a trip hazard/risk to the public. My child's scooter hit the edge of an uneven slabs 2 days a go and they went over the handle bar flat on their face, thankfully no damage, just tears. (This time) . You are neglecting your responsibility here. This reply from my complaint is absolutely insulting. As for the 'new screed' of pavement your workforce done recently (where the cones are still there weeks later) the finishing is laughable. Extremely poor standards and mentioned this in my previous complain, this also highlights that no one has actually visited Dane Close. We all pay a large amount of council tax on this road so we are in our right to express our concern. Please someone contact me and we can meet in person and I can walk you up our Close and discuss this matter together. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Dane Close, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Potholes, 15th December
item.description:
There are several potholes, but three of them are getting bigger. From St. Paul's Cray Road, entrance to The Drive (BR7 6LW) towards number 1. A few metres before number 1, there are two potholes ( 1 quite big) , and there is one more right next to number 1. I reported this problem a few months ago, but it has not been fixed. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Drive, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves everywhere on pavement. Slippy and dangerous after rainfall, 15th December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tremaine Road, Anerley, Greater London
